key_findings: Comprehensive review of eddy current NDT techniques; ferromagnetic materials present permeability-conductivity coupling challenges; multi-frequency and pulsed EC and saturation techniques help decouple conductivity from permeability
tags: pillar_C eddy_current NDT review ferromagnetic contactless

key_findings: Comprehensive resistivity data tabulated for steels by composition and heat treatment; alloying elements increase resistivity systematically; Wiedemann-Franz law links electrical and thermal conductivity
tags: pillar_B resistivity reference_data steel physical_properties

key_findings: Microstructural features (grain boundaries phases precipitates dislocations) simultaneously affect electrical thermal and mechanical properties; same lattice defects that scatter electrons impede dislocation motion creating physical link between conductivity and strength
tags: pillar_B microstructure phase_transformations physical_metallurgy foundational

key_findings: Eddy current conductivity correlates strongly with hardness for heat-treated steels (R^2 > 0.9); tempering increases conductivity and decreases hardness monotonically; correlation is alloy-specific
tags: multi conductivity hardness eddy_current mechanical_properties key_bridging

key_findings: CCT diagrams for low-alloy steels show how cooling rate determines microstructure; tempering produces systematic carbide precipitation and dislocation recovery; alloying elements retard softening by forming stable alloy carbides
tags: pillar_B heat_treatment microstructure CCT tempering steel

key_findings: CCT diagrams for low-alloy steels show how cooling rate determines microstructure; tempering produces systematic carbide precipitation and dislocation recovery; alloying elements retard softening by forming stable alloy carbides
tags: pillar_B heat_treatment microstructure CCT tempering steel

key_findings: CCT diagrams for low-alloy steels show how cooling rate determines microstructure; tempering produces systematic carbide precipitation and dislocation recovery; alloying elements retard softening by forming stable alloy carbides
tags: pillar_B heat_treatment microstructure CCT tempering steel

key_findings: ANN predicts steel resistivity within 3-5% of measured values from composition and temperature; carbon content and temperature are strongest predictors; nonlinear composition interactions captured by ANN but missed by linear models
tags: pillar_D ANN resistivity prediction steel composition

key_findings: Including workpiece metallurgical data improves ML prediction of machining quality by 15-25%; random forest and gradient boosting outperform SVM and ANN; workpiece hardness ranks among top 3 most important features
tags: pillar_D machine_learning surface_quality metallurgy random_forest gradient_boosting

key_findings: Machinability depends on complete tool-workpiece-process system; cutting forces predictable from material flow stress and shear angle; machinability index (B1112=100%) has severe limitations
tags: pillar_A machinability cutting_mechanics tool_wear foundational

key_findings: Machinability depends on complete tool-workpiece-process system; cutting forces predictable from material flow stress and shear angle; machinability index (B1112=100%) has severe limitations
tags: pillar_A machinability cutting_mechanics tool_wear foundational

key_findings: Machinability depends on complete tool-workpiece-process system; cutting forces predictable from material flow stress and shear angle; machinability index (B1112=100%) has severe limitations
tags: pillar_A machinability cutting_mechanics tool_wear foundational

key_findings: Feature selection is critical for ANN tool wear monitoring; MLP with 1-2 hidden layers sufficient; training data should cover full operating range; model transfer across workpiece materials remains major challenge
tags: pillar_D ANN tool_wear monitoring review turning

key_findings: Cutting speed dominant factor for flank wear (>50% contribution); feed rate dominant for surface roughness (>60%); optimal conditions: moderate speed low feed moderate depth
tags: pillar_A AISI_4340 turning surface_roughness flank_wear Taguchi

key_findings: Tool-chip interface seizure is normal in metal cutting; tool wear mechanisms depend on workpiece material properties and cutting temperature; inclusions (MnS Ca-treated oxides) improve machinability
tags: pillar_A tool_wear metallurgy flow_zone foundational

key_findings: Material properties reducing machinability: high hot strength work hardening low thermal conductivity abrasive phases; tool material selection significantly affects machinability; machinability is a system property
tags: pillar_A machinability difficult_to_cut review aerospace

key_findings: Pulsed eddy current extracts conductivity from ferromagnetic metals via late-time signal decay; method validated against four-probe DC within 5%; minimum specimen thickness requirements established
tags: pillar_C pulsed_eddy_current ferromagnetic conductivity NDT

key_findings: Pulsed eddy current extracts conductivity from ferromagnetic metals via late-time signal decay; method validated against four-probe DC within 5%; minimum specimen thickness requirements established
tags: pillar_C pulsed_eddy_current ferromagnetic conductivity NDT

key_findings: Flank wear VB=0.3 mm is standard tool life criterion; Taylor tool-life equation (VT^n=C) provides machinability comparison framework; standardised conditions essential for valid material comparison
tags: pillar_A tool_life flank_wear standard ISO turning

key_findings: Plastic deformation increases resistivity via dislocation and point defect generation; dislocation contribution ~2-4 micro-ohm-cm per 10^12 cm/cm^3 in iron; recovery and recrystallisation reduce deformation-induced resistivity
tags: pillar_B resistivity deformation dislocations point_defects iron

key_findings: Random forest and SVM outperform simple ANN for tool wear prediction with moderate datasets; multi-sensor feature fusion improves accuracy; feature extraction (time frequency time-frequency) is critical
tags: pillar_D machine_learning tool_wear monitoring SVM random_forest

key_findings: Eddy current imaging detects and sizes defects as small as 0.5 mm; multi-frequency measurements separate surface and subsurface information; spatial resolution depends on probe size and frequency
tags: multi eddy_current imaging defect NDT signal_processing

key_findings: Cutting forces increase approximately linearly with workpiece hardness; tool wear transitions from adhesion to abrasion/diffusion with increasing hardness; white layer formation is critical surface integrity concern
tags: pillar_A hard_turning hardened_steel review RSM ANN

key_findings: Cutting forces increase approximately linearly with workpiece hardness; tool wear transitions from adhesion to abrasion/diffusion with increasing hardness; white layer formation is critical surface integrity concern
tags: pillar_A hard_turning hardened_steel review RSM ANN

key_findings: Machinability ratings for hundreds of steel grades; carbon sulphur and lead are strongest composition-machinability determinants; annealed microstructures generally better machinability than Q&T
tags: pillar_A machinability steel_grades reference ASM cutting_data

key_findings: Machinability ratings for hundreds of steel grades; carbon sulphur and lead are strongest composition-machinability determinants; annealed microstructures generally better machinability than Q&T
tags: pillar_A machinability steel_grades reference ASM cutting_data

key_findings: Four-probe Kelvin method eliminates contact resistance errors; applicable to all metallic materials including ferromagnetic steels; temperature must be controlled and corrected to 20C
tags: pillar_C four_probe resistivity standard ASTM DC

key_findings: Eddy current conductivity measurement standardised for non-ferromagnetic metals; ferromagnetic materials require special consideration; calibration with certified reference standards mandatory
tags: pillar_C eddy_current conductivity standard ASTM

key_findings: Matthiessen's rule decomposes resistivity into microstructural contributions; carbon in solid solution increases Fe resistivity by ~3.4 micro-ohm-cm per at.%; phase transformations produce large resistivity changes: martensite >> bainite > pearlite > ferrite
tags: pillar_B resistivity electron_scattering Matthiessen foundational
